document.title: Primitives
document.paragraph:
All Vision2 primitives inherit EV_PRIMITIVE.
2What is a primitive? A primitive is a Vision2 widget that may not contain other widgets. Primitives may be placed in
../10_containers/index.html containers , but a
../index.html widget may not contain any child widgets. Some examples of primitives are EV_BUTTON and EV_LABEL. A list of all the classes in the primitives cluster may be found
/libraries/vision2/reference/interface/widgets/primitives/index.html here .
2Features of a primitive
All primitives inherit from EV_TOOLTIPABLE and therefore can have tooltips assigned to them. They all inherit many features from EV_WIDGET Each descendent of EV_PRIMITIVE will typically have many available features, specific to their type. For example, EV_SEPARATOR has no extra features, but EV_LABEL has features for modifying the current font and also the text to de displayed.
2Widgets as item holders
Although no primitive can contain another widget, certain primitives may contain one or more
../../20_items/index.html items . One example of this is an
../../../reference/interface/widgets/primitives/ev_list_chart.html EV_LIST containing
../../../reference/interface/items/ev_list_item_chart.html EV_LIST_ITEM s.
